description:
Data Scientist - R01547941

About Brillio:



Brillio is one of the fastest growing digital technology service providers and a partner of choice for many Fortune 1000 companies seeking to turn disruption into a competitive advantage through innovative digital adoption. Brillio, renowned for its world-class professionals, referred to as "Brillians", distinguishes itself through their capacity to seamlessly integrate cutting-edge digital and design thinking skills with an unwavering dedication to client satisfaction.
Brillio takes pride in its status as an employer of choice, consistently attracting the most exceptional and talented individuals due to its unwavering emphasis on contemporary, groundbreaking technologies, and exclusive digital projects. Brillio's relentless commitment to providing an exceptional experience to its Brillians and nurturing their full potential consistently garners them the Great Place to Work® certification year after year.

Data Scientist
Primary Skills
Problem Formulation (Business problem to Data Science Problem), OKR Validation against statistical measures, Data Wrangling, Data Storytelling & Insight Generation, Problem Solving, Excel VBA, Data Curiosity, Technical Decision Making (How many iterations to go for vs when to stop iterating), Communication & Articulation: Vocal & Written, Business Acumen (Consume new domains quickly to learn through data), Design Thinking, Data Literacy
Job requirements
Role: Data Scientist
Years of Experience: 8+ years
Location: Irving-TX-USA(Hybrid)
Description What you’ll be doing... This candidate will perform analytics, create predictive models, apply machine learning techniques, and/or develop GenAI methods for high-visibility projects, as a member of a collaborative and open team that prides themselves on innovative solutions. The data scientist will explore information from multiple sources in order to gain maximum insight and provide a competitive advantage. The “data science” tasks may include statistical analyses, knowledge discovery, data mining, machine learning, and predictive modeling.
Responsibilities will include:
Performing data studies of new and diverse data sources.
- Conducting statistical modeling and experiment design. - Discovering “stories” told by the data and present them to peers, software developers, business analysts and business managers.
Creating and validating predictive models and advanced algorithms; train AI and machine learning algorithms.
What are we looking for: You’ll need to have: - Bachelor's degree or four or more years of work experience.
Six or more years of analytics and data science experience
Strong knowledge of programming and pattern recognition.
- Mastery of statistics, machine learning, algorithms, predictive modeling, and advanced mathematics. - Knowledge of deep learning and GenAI techniques.
- Experience working with security data. - Experience working with networking data. - Experience using SQL (Structured Query Language) and other programming languages (R, C++, Python) for statistical computing, graphics, and data mining.
Experience with RDBMS, columnar, and NoSQL database technologies.
Experience with Big Data and related tools such as Hadoop or Spark .
Familiarity with tools such as R, Rstudio, Python scipy and numpy, Jupyter notebook is desired.
Even better if you have one or more of the following:
Advanced Degree in one of: Computer Science, Data Science, Physics (or other science), Engineering, or Mathematics/Statistics
Strong critical thinking skills and the ability to relate them to Client business processes and operations.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills as well as the ability to bridge the gap between data science and business management.
Ability to collaborate with business units, IT, and data scientists across the enterprise to support descriptive and predictive analytics processes.
Strong exploratory analysis skills and ability to think and research creatively. If client and this role sound like we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every “even better” qualification listed above.
Why should you apply for this role?
(Practice Pitch)
As Brillio continues to gain momentum as a trusted partner for our clients in their digital transformation journey, we strive to set new benchmarks for speed and value creation. The Advisory and Value Assurance (AVA) team at Brillio is at the forefront of leading this charge by reimagining and executing how we structure, sell and deliver our services to better serve our clients.
